topics.body:
So I got the initial final set up for the cast of _Shonen Jump vs. Capcom: Heroes United_, guys. :) I had to wrap up with the last 8 hidden characters. I plan to tackle DLC characters when I get the chance. Order of this list is Capcom character then their Jump rival.

Ryu
Goku
Chun-Li
Lenalee
Haggar
Kinnikuman
Felicia
Lala
Mega Man
Arale
Batsu
Yusuke
Ibuki
Naruto
Ruby Heart
Luffy
Kaijin no Soki
Ichigo
Jedah
DIO
Wesker
Light
Viewtiful Joe
Wingman
Phoenix Wright
Kankichi Ryotsu
Tron
Hitomi
Seth
Cell
Akuma
Raoh
Firebrand
Neuro
Nina
Meisuke/Nube
Jin
Seiya

Fortinbras - Final boss in Arcade Mode

So Capcom has Street Fighter, Street Fighter II, Final Fight, Darkstalkers, Mega Man, Rival Schools, Street Fighter III, Dai Kouka Frontier/Marvel vs. Capcom 2, Onimusha: Dawn of Dreams, Darkstalkers 3, Resident Evil, Viewtiful Joe, Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney, Mega Man Legends, Street Fighter IV, Super Street Fighter II Turbo, Ghosts 'n Goblins, Breath of Fire II, and Cyberbots: Fullmetal Madness for reps, and Shonen Jump has Dragon Ball, D.Gray-man, Kinnikuman, To Love-Ru, Dr. Slump, Yu Yu Hakusho, Naruto, One Piece, Bleach, JoJo's Bizarre Adventure, Death Note, Yume Senshi Wingman, Kochikame, Cat's Eye, Dragon Ball Z, Fist of the North Star, Demon Detective Neuro Nogami, Hell Teacher Nubei, and Saint Seiya for reps right now.

topics.body:
Well pets, I figure it's Monday for the rest of the world by now so I figured I'd get this started. As you all know, I am a massive Vocaloid fanboy. There is just something about them that connects with me, and with that knowledge I'd like to welcome you all to the first ever Derpibooru version of Miku Monday. If you're curious as to what Miku Monday is, allow me to enilghten you. Each Monday your gracious and glorious SquiggyBomb will post three different Miku songs as well as a short bio as to what the song is about and/or what the song means to me as an individual. So let's get this started!

"Love is War":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g1Dqb6uJ8WY
Let's start this off by going back in time a bit. Love is War was the first ever Miku song to grace my virgin ears. This song holds a very special place in my heart as not only the first song I heard from Miku but the first Miku song I ever learned to sing. Love is War is about the incessant urge for the center of your affections to actually acknowledge your affections. That's right. The entire song is an extended "I hope senpai notices me."

"Rolling Girl":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FMDxKRx10mU
A song that has no defined meaning but can be interpreted many ways. Although if I must confess it's the piano that always brings me back and not just Miku herself. Something about that opening tune never fails to get my heart racing and my foot tapping.

"World is Mine":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RdXgoIjS7UM
And we finish with another of the most famous Miku songs. World is Mine really illustrates the versatility of Miku's character and identity to me. How she can be a soul tormented by self-loathing or a materialistic bitch and it never feel out of place or character. Although the core of World is Mine is about how even the most materialistic people on the planet can still have a heart. It also helps that it's catchier than herpes.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff
